3.1.1.6.1.2. ce_expansion.utility.gen_coeffs module¶

ce_expansion.utility.gen_coeffs.calculate_gamma_products(coordination: iterable, total_gamma: float) → float[source]¶

Scales the total gamma by coordination number. This will break if you fail to give it a sorted list whose values increase by 1 and do not skip numbers.

Parameters

  • coordination (list) – List of coordination numbers to calculate

  • total_gamma (float) – Total gamma coefficient.

Returns

The calculated gamma product.

ce_expansion.utility.gen_coeffs.calculate_total_gamma(element1: str, element2: str, ce_data: str = '../data/bulkcedata.csv', cn_data: str = '../data/cndata.csv') → tuple[source]¶

Calculates the total gamma coefficient. The total gamma coefficient is defined as the product of the gamma coefficient, the bulk cohesive energy, and the inverse of the square root of the coordination number of the bulk.

Parameters

  • element1 (str) – The first element, A, in the bimetallic pair AB

  • element2 (str) – The second element, B, in the bimetallic pair AB

  • ce_data (str) – Data source for bulk cohesive energies.

  • cn_data (str) – Data source for the bulk coordination number.

Returns

A tuple containing the total gamma coefficients of A and B (in that order) in the bimetallic pair AB

ce_expansion.utility.gen_coeffs.gen_coeffs_dict_from_raw(metal1, metal2, bulkce_m1, bulkce_m2, homo_bde_m1, homo_bde_m2, hetero_bde, cnmax=12)[source]¶

Generates the Bond-Centric half bond energy terms for a bimetallic pair AB. Coordination number 0 is given the value None. Dictionary is used with AtomGraph to calculate total CE of bimetallic nanoparticles. Relies on raw data arguments to create dictionary.

Args: - metal1 (str): atomic symbol of metal 1 - metal2 (str): atomic symbol of metal 2 - bulkce_m1 (float): bulk cohesive energy (in eV / atom) of metal1 - bulkce_m2 (float): bulk cohesive energy (in eV / atom) of metal2 - homo_bde_m1 (float): m1-m1 (homoatomic) bond dissociation energy - homo_bde_m2 (float): m2-m2 (homoatomic) bond dissociation energy - hetero_bde (float): m1-m2 (heteroatomic) bond dissociation energy

KArgs: - cnmax: maximum bulk coordination number (CN) of metals

(Default: 12)

Returns: - (dict): form dict[m1][m2][CN] = half bond energy term

ce_expansion.utility.gen_coeffs.generate_coefficient_dictionary(element1: str, element2: str, min_coord: int = 0, max_coord: int = -1, cn_data: str = '../data/cndata.csv') → dict[source]¶

Generates the total Gamma coefficients for a bimetallic pair AB from min_coord to max_coord. Coordination number 0 is given the value None. The total Gamma coefficient is defined as the product of the gamma coefficient, the bulk cohesive energy, and the inverse of the square root of the coordination number of the bulk.

Parameters

  • element1 (str) – The first element, A, in the bimetallic pair AB

  • element2 (str) – The second element, B, in the bimetallic pair AB

  • min_coord (int) – The minimum coordination number to investigate. Defaults to 0.

  • max_coord – The maximum coordination number to investigate. The default value of -1 indicates the maximum coordination number to investigate is that of the bulk.

  • cn_data (str) – The CSV file containing bulk coordination number information

Returns

A dictionary of form dict[element1][element2][CN] = float

ce_expansion.utility.gen_coeffs.read_data_table(filename: str) → dict[source]¶

Reads in a CSV file containing columnwise data for various elements, and returns a dictionary containing the data. Lines beginning with “#” are ignored :param filename: A valid filename for a csv file :type filename: str

Returns

A dictionary containing the data of interest
